title: Dev2Prod - One or more customization definitions could not be imported
content:
When you run a Service Catalog data import, the following error occurs: One or more customization definitions could not be imported due to an error.  

Cause 1

You have added a custom field to a catalog form, for example, an offering form. The custom field belongs to a custom record type ("custom application"). When you export the Service Catalog package, you select only the Service Portfolio/Catalog module. As a result, the configurations of the custom application aren't exported to the package. During import, the custom field value isn't imported because the custom application isn't available in the target tenant. The following figure shows an example.

Solution 1

  1. Run an export by selecting both the Service Portfolio/Catalog module (both Configurations and Data) and the custom application (Configurations)：
  2. Run the import again. 

Cause 2

The root cause is that in the source tenant you have created a custom field for a catalog record type and the custom field is linked to an out-of-the-box (OOTB) record type; however, in the target tenant the Enable a custom entity link between two out-of-the-box record types option is turned off (by default). As a result, the following message occurs during the import, and the custom field has a null value after the import. The following figure shows an example. 

Here are example steps to reproduce this issue:

Do the following in the source tenant: 

  1. Turn on the Enable a custom entity link between two out-of-the-box record types option on the Application Settings page.
  2. Define one custom field of the entity link type for Category and link the field to Article. 
  3. Add this custom field to the full form for Category.
  4. Create a new Article record.
  5. Create a new Category record and in the custom field select the new article you have created.
  6. In Package Manager, run an export by selecting the Service Portfolio/Catalog module > Category > Configurations and Data.

In the target tenant, make sure that the Enable a custom entity link between two out-of-the-box record types option is turned off (by default), and then import the exported package. 

Solution 2

Do the following in the target tenant:

  1. Navigate to Administration > Application Settings, and turn on the Enable a custom entity link between two out-of-the-box record types option.
  2. Rerun the import in Package Manager.
